intro: Vilfa stellata, commonly known as the starflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its star-shaped, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Vilfa stellata is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate, early spring blooms.
